dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5690 IH: Advancing Health Savings Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Moore of Utah introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow for certain distributions from a health savings account for medical expenses incurred during the 60-day period before the account was established.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Advancing Health Savings Act of 2023.

section.header: Special rule for certain medical expenses incurred before establishment of health savings account

subsection.text: Section 223(d)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Treatment of certain medical expenses incurred before establishment of account
subparagraph.text: If a health savings account is established during the 60-day period beginning on the date that coverage of the account beneficiary under a high deductible health plan begins, then, solely for purposes of determining whether an amount paid is used for a qualified medical expense, such account shall be treated as having been established on the date that such coverage begins.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply with respect to coverage beginning after December 31, 2023.
